title: Energy Storage System Solutions Engineer
description:
**About AESC US LLC**
=====================


AESC is an exciting, newly created global organization committed to solving the challenges of a sustainable future and becoming the leading supplier of full-value-chain battery solutions. Our lithium-ion batteries can be found in nearly one million electric vehicles worldwide and have a stellar safety record of zero-critical issues. AESC US is leading the way in battery technology. We design and manufacture EV battery technology for various electric vehicles and equipment. We are working hard towards unlocking the full potential of sustainable energy and climate change mitigation. We will continue to build upon our successes and expand into new markets and industries, producing innovative and competitive products and technologies that advance the goal of a zero-carbon emission future. AESC is headquartered in Japan and has battery manufacturing locations in Japan, UK, China, and the U.S.

**AESC Mission**
================


Our mission is to solve the challenges for a sustainable future. Together, we can make a meaningful impact.

**About the Role**
==================


The Energy Storage System Solutions Engineer is responsible for designing and implementing energy storage solutions for various applications. They collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and optimize energy storage systems that meet client requirements. This role involves analyzing technical specifications, conducting feasibility studies, and providing technical support to clients or internal stakeholders. The Energy Storage System Solutions Engineer stays updated with industry trends and regulations to ensure compliance and drive innovation in energy storage technologies.

**What You Will Do**
====================

* Design and develop energy storage system solutions based on client requirements and project specifications.
* Conduct feasibility studies to assess the technical viability and economic feasibility of energy storage projects.
* Collaborate with product development teams to optimize energy storage systems for maximum efficiency and performance.
* Analyze technical specifications and energy data to determine the appropriate energy storage technologies and configurations.
* Provide technical assistance and support to clients, project managers, and sales teams throughout the project lifecycle.
* Ensure compliance with industry standards, regulations, and codes related to energy storage systems.
* Perform system-level simulations and analyses to validate the performance of energy storage solutions.
* Collaborate with suppliers and external partners to source and integrate energy storage components and systems.
* Stay updated with advancements in energy storage technologies, market trends, and emerging applications.
* Support business development efforts by participating in client meetings, preparing technical proposals, and presenting solutions to potential customers.
* Participate in project bidding and contract negotiations, be responsible for major project bidding proposals, lead the formulation and review of technical agreements
* Build and enhance energy storage solution capabilities, optimize marketing toolkits

**What You Need**
=================

* Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Energy Engineering, or a related field. Master's degree is preferred.
* Previous experience in energy storage system design, integration, or related fields.
* Strong understanding of energy storage technologies, such as battery energy storage, flywheels, or compressed air energy storage.
* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and project management skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams and effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Detail-oriented with a strong focus on quality and compliance.
* Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision.
* Bilingual in English and Mandarin Chinese is highly desired.

**What We Offer**
=================


Welcome to our state-of-the-art Gigafactory, where you'll have the opportunity to tackle the world's most fascinating challenges alongside exceptionally talented individuals who are driven to make a difference. At AESC, we offer a comprehensive compensation package, including a competitive salary and a rewarding AESC bonus program. In addition, we provide a range of valuable benefits, such as 401K, and health insurance. We strive to ensure that our employees are well taken care of, enabling them to focus on their work and contribute to our collective mission of changing the world.

  

* An inclusive and diverse work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development.
* Highly automated, clean, safe, and temperature-controlled production environment
* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
* HSA and Flexible Spending Accounts
* 401K with company match
* Life Insurance (Company paid and additional voluntary life available)
* Paid Vacation and 14 Paid Holidays
* Short term and long-term disability coverage (Company Paid)
* Tuition reimbursement

**Application Process**
=======================


Even if you don't meet every requirement listed, if you believe this role suits you well, we encourage you to apply. Your application gives us the opportunity to learn more about you and explore potential fits within our team.


Following the submission of your application, we are committed to providing timely responses to all applicants, though response times may vary depending on the volume of submissions. If you do not receive an immediate response, please rest assured that this in no way reflects on the quality of your candidacy. Your application will be retained in our files, and we may reach out to you for future roles that align with your skills and interests. As our organization experiences rapid growth, we appreciate your patience in this process. We are actively working each day to enhance our application procedures to ensure a smoother and more efficient experience for all applicants. Thank you for your understanding and enthusiasm for joining our dynamic team.

**Equal Employment Opportunity**
================================


At AESC, we are committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) to all individuals. We participate in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S Join us in our passion to design, manufacture, and sell high-performance products, contributing to a sustainable and zero-carbon emission future.

**Physical Requirements**
=========================


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable otherwise qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions.

* Ability to sit for extended periods of time.
* Ability to read, write, speak, hear; stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach and lift with hands and arms frequently throughout the day.
* Required to occasionally lift, push, pull and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally required to lift, push, pull and/or move up to 35 pounds.

**Work Environment**
====================


The work environment is primarily an automated manufacturing plant with a concrete floor and is characterized by some temperature extremes, moderate noise, and forklift traffic. The individual must be able to perform all essential functions as appropriate on the plant floor, in meetings, and with employees, management, customers and suppliers.


Candidate must perform the essential duties and responsibilities with or without reasonable accommodation efficiently and accurately, and without causing significant safety threat to self or others. The statements made herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this job classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive and inclusive list of all responsibilities, duties, and/or skills required of personnel so classified.


Hiring is contingent upon successful completion of drug screen and background check. AESC US LLC is a drug-free workplace.

title: Pre-Silicon Verification Engineer (VIP)
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------

  

We are seeking experienced Senior/Lead ASIC Verification Engineers to join our Poland team. The successful candidates will be responsible for developing VIPs for Intel Server products for many internal customers.


Although this is a fully remote position, you are welcome to visit our office in Gdansk or a coworking space in Katowice.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Participate in the creation of VIP portfolio of different protocols
* Work on creating and maintaining VIP which includes developing BFM, writing code coverage and adding scoreboard
* Actively involve in hardware modeling and simulation, random and focused stimulus generation, and functional coverage
* Review and sign-off on VIP development and updates from a technical perspective including methodology and protocol functional perspective
* Liaise with Architects/methodology experts to achieve resolutions on issues or driving output from an architecture/methodology perspective
* Act as the local “go-to” person on all technical aspects of VIP
* Utilize excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively collaborate with team members

**Qualifications**
------------------

 **Key requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field; Master's degree is considered an advantage
* 5+ years of industry experience in a related role
* Hands-on experience with System Verilog & Verilog
* Experience in at least 2 verification projects using VMM/OVM/UVM methodologies
* Experience in digital design or computer architecture, object-oriented programming (OOP), or design verification System Verilog OVM/UVM

**Nice to have:**

* Experience with SystemC and modeling
* Experience with Cache Coherency
* Unix shell, Python, and Perl scripting
* Knowledge of Industry standard protocols – PCIe, AXI, CXL etc.
* Experience with simulation/debug tools such as VCS, Verdi

**What we offer:**


At Intel, employees share in successes, enjoy comprehensive rewards and are inspired by an innovative & inclusive workplace. What can you expect when there is a match between us?

* We guarantee you will be working in a **safe environment**, in an organization which profoundly understands the current health situation worldwide. Either at your own home or in our premises if needed, the security and wellbeing of you and your family stands as our utmost responsibility.
* You will have constant opportunities to **develop your professional career through technical and soft skills training**, taking part in innovation projects or rotational programs
* **Flexible working hours** are important to us
* And our **Amazing Benefits to make life easier and more enjoyable are waiting for you**: Stock Program, Annual and Quarterly Bonuses, Employee Pension Plan, Medical Plan and life insurance for you and your Family, Peer to peer recognition, Ticket restaurant Card, Multisport Card / Holiday card, Groups of enthusiasts, Exclusive employee discounts, (online) events and many more.
* **Rewards Experience @ Intel Poland**: https://intel.ly/3ftPwog

**Inside this Business Group**
------------------------------

  

In the Design Engineering Group (DEG), we take pride in developing the best-in-class SOCs, Cores, and IPs that power Intel’s products. From development, to integration, validation, and manufacturing readiness, our mission is to deliver leadership products through the pursuit of Moore’s Law and groundbreaking innovations. DEG is Intel’s engineering group, supplying silicon to business units as well as other engineering teams. As a critical provider of all Intel products, DEG leadership has a responsibility to ensure the delivery of these products in a cost efficient and effective manner.  

**Posting Statement**
---------------------

  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.  

**Benefits**
------------

  

We offer a total compensation package that ranks among the best in the industry. It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. Find more information about all of our Amazing Benefits here.  

**Working Model**
-----------------

  

This role is available as a fully home-based and generally would require you to attend Intel sites only occasionally based on business need. This role may also be available as our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site. **In certain circumstances the work model may change to accommodate business needs.**

title: Engineer II - Electrical Engineering
description:
**Description**  



  

We are committed to building a workplace where everyone feels heard and respected, and extending our culture of care so that every individual can reach their full potential. We want you to have a sense of belonging and feel valued for your contributions and the perspectives you bring.  

  

**Summary:**  

  

The Engineer II – Electrical Engineering provides engineering / conceptual and detailed designs of utility scale renewable power plants (wind & solar) and battery storage systems. This role aids in operations support of renewable power generation projects; while supporting development, engineering, and construction of projects.  

  

**Requirements:*** Develops preliminary and detailed design of AC (Low, Medium, and High Voltage) and DC systems, including DC power blocks (PV) and MV AC collection systems (PV/Wind).
* Develops DC block design (PV), MV AC design and BOM preparation.
* Develops models of the AC substation and collection systems and performs and Load Flow and Short Circuit analyses, DC and AC loss calculations, cable ampacity studies, and AC/DC cable sizing.
* Evaluates Inverter ratings and optimizes inverter units for Solar and BESS installations.
* Performs calculations for sizing and specifying main power transformers.
* Supports estimating of company developed and 3rd party projects by creating preliminary designs for proposed projects and quantity counts for estimating electrical equipment costs.
* Works with designers and assists in the development of construction drawings and documentation to effectively communicate electrical installation details to construction teams.
* Assists in the preparation of technical specifications to identify design requirements for procurement of electrical materials and equipment.
* Performs technical review of proposed equipment to ensure acceptability to company, client, and industry standards.
* Attends work regularly and punctually, as scheduled or expected.
* Complies with Employee Handbook, Code of Conduct and Company Policies & Procedures.
* Presents, supports, and leads-by-example with a safety and quality-oriented attitude.
* Provides support to construction during the construction and commissioning phases.
* Reviews work instructions periodically to ensure compliance with industry and client standards.
* Develops new methods and standards for Group design activities.
* Visits sites as needed during pre-construction and construction to support project needs.

  

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:*** Intermediate level of knowledge in:
	+ Power Systems Analysis, load flow and short circuit modeling
	+ Reactive compensation evaluation
	+ DC and AC Electrical Design
	+ Design for Constructability
	+ Oral and written skills to include:
	+ Clear and concise technical writing
	+ Ability to communicate issues to peers
* Knowledge in:
	+ Medium to High Voltage Substation Design concepts
	+ Grounding System Design Concepts
	+ Project Scheduling Concepts
	+ Preparation of Equipment Specifications
	+ US and Canadian Industry Standards
	+ Detailed Design Software:
		- Math CAD
		- Fundamental understanding of CAD concepts
		- Fundamental knowledge of power system software such as Dig SILENT, SKM, ETAP
* Strong interpersonal skills, including listening and summarizing skills
* Strong organizational and prioritization skills.
* Functional competencies include attention to detail, excellence, prioritization, teamwork, and continuous improvement.

  

**Qualifications:*** Bachelor Degree in electrical engineering or equivalent (equivalent is 8 years of experience), required.
* Master’s degree in electrical engineering, preferred.
* Engineer-in-Training certification, preferred.
* 2 or more years of electrical engineering experience, preferably experience in electrical power or renewable energy industry, required.
* 2 or more years of experience in power generation industry with EPC experience, preferred.
* Ability to travel 5 to 15% domestically.
* Must possess a valid Driver’s License.

  

**Anticipated base salary range:** $78,000 - $100,000  

  

The final agreed upon compensation is based on individual education, qualifications, experience, and work location. This position is bonus eligible.  

  

RES offers benefits that are effective first day of employment. These benefits include the following:* Medical, Dental and Vision
* Health Savings Account with employer contribution
* Flexible Spending Accounts
* 4x pay Basic Life and Voluntary Life
* Short and Long Term Disability
* Accident, Hospital, and Critical Illness
* 401 (k) plan with 6% company match
* 4 weeks Paid Time Off (PTO) and 10 Paid Holidays
* Tuition Reimbursement and Green Car Reimbursement
* Volunteer and Charity Matching
* Paid Parental Leave and Paid Sabbatical Leave
* Employee Referral Bonus
* Employee Discounts and Wellness programs
* Wellness Reimbursement

  

**Physical requirements and environment:**  

The work environment and physical demands characteristics are representative of those the employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  

  

Rarely: Climbing, crouching, kneeling, pulling/pushing/lifting between 5-15lbs., and stooping are required.  

Occasionally: Carrying 5-15lbs., gripping, handling, pinching, and walking are required.  

Frequently: Standing is required.  

Constantly: Reading, grasping, hearing, reaching, vision, repetitive motion, and sitting is required.  

  

Rarely exposed to extreme cold, heat, and humidity, and wet climates, in the working environment.  

Occasionally exposed to noise and hazards in the work environment.  

  

We maintain a drug-free workplace. Candidates will be required to pass a pre-employment background investigation and drug test as a condition of employment.  

  

RES is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.

title: Electrical Excitation Field Engineer FEP
description:
**Job Summary:**


A TFA FEP is an entry level position. You will start by being enrolled in FieldCore's **Field Engineering Program (FEP).** While in the FEP, you will develop in-depth technical expertise, lean thinking and leadership skills and will have a unique opportunity to go through:

* In-person and Online training Curriculum
* On-the-job trainings
* Learning from experienced Technical Field Advisors (TFA’s)


You will gain experience and grow your career while traveling and helping provide power to communities. Upon successful graduation from the **FEP program, you will be eligible for a TFA – Electrical Excitation position.**


The **TFA – Electrical Excitation** is responsible for the Power Turbine Generator Excitation System and is accountable for control of costs, quality control - preservation, protection, security, or safekeeping of turbine modules, office trailers, tool trailers/gang boxes, cranes, and accessories, spare parts. As well as external reporting: Technical Field Advisers may report to the client, the plant/utility owner, the construction firm, giving daily or weekly updates on job progress or as needed.

**Essential Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Maintain strong safety mindset to assure the executed work reflects the technical requirements within GE safety standards
* Extensive travel to and from projects and various field assignments will be required
* Ability and willingness to work holidays, weekends and overtime as required by field assignments
* Pre-outage and installation planning; possibly recommending and administering policies and procedures
* Lead execution of retrofit projects, including: Excitation systems (EX2100 EX2100e, LS2100, LS2100e and HMI products), Generator Protection Systems (GPP), and Power System Stabilization systems
* Support warranty administration and troubleshooting issues
* Provide timely and accurate internal and external reports
* Drive customer satisfaction through commitment to quality.
* Support the business growth initiatives
* Trace through the software documentation
* Implement control constant modifications
* Reading and modifying software sequencing
* Set up and modify the hardware and software associated with the Gas/Steam Turbine Excitation / LCI system
* Implement excitation control system software changes
* Work with both analog and digital controls including logic
* Provide Technical Direction for writing install and terminate, complete functionality checks, and troubleshooting the turbine excitation / LCI system. Perform start-up/shut-down sequencing and turbine/generator operation
* May be assigned other duties to help proactively drive our FieldCore vision and align with our organization’s core values.

**Required Qualifications & Experience**:

* Engineering degree or equivalent.
* Strong technical competence in reading and interpreting electrical/mechanical flow and instrument diagrams.
* Extensive travel to and from projects and various field assignments will be required.
* English proficiency required.

**Desired Characteristics:**

* Experience in Field Services or Power Generation.
* Positive can-do attitude with the ability to communicate with internal and external customers.
* Experience and training on Alstom, Siemens, GE Aeroderivative, or other OEM equipment
* Computer skills with familiarity of MS Office products. Ability to learn other software tool applications to support HMI and application changes.
* Electronics and/or mechanical trouble shooting skills with a “Hands-on approach.”
* Willingness to learn and problem solve
* Strong ownership and work ethic

**Benefits:**

* Competitive Salary and Benefits
* Extensive training opportunities and mentorship
* Classroom and virtual trainings
* Regional and Global exposure
* Working on multimillion dollar equipment
* Wide range of career path opportunities
* LEAN training
* Learning and developing communication skills

**Compensation and Benefits:**  

  

The annual salary range for this position is $67,100 to $110,700. This is an exempt from overtime position. FieldCore benefits include insurance (medical, dental, vision, disability, and life), retirement savings, health and Wellness reimbursement, and a bonus or incentive program. Eligibility for FieldCore benefits is determined under the terms of the applicable benefits plan.

 **About FieldCore:**


FieldCore,part of GE Vernova, is an independent, industrial field services organization focused on World-Class Execution across the power generation sector. Our team includes more than 10,000 of the foremost experts in field services all focused on one thing; delivering excellent outcomes for our customers. Our Core Values of Safety, Integrity, Quality and Inclusion are the foundation of everything we do to empower the people who power the world. For more information visit our website www.fieldcore.com.

*FieldCore is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex, national origin, age, veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, ancestry, genetic information, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by law*

title: Electrical Engineer Specialist
description:
**Looking to leave a lasting footprint in the consulting and design engineering world?**

With an impressive legacy spanning over four decades, DLB Associates is on the hunt for a strong Electrical Engineer. Join our team and contribute to our high-impact projects, which encompass some of the most technologically advanced environments in the world.

**Location:** Nationwide

**Salary:** $100,000 - $121,000

**Position Title:** Electrical Engineer

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Electrical Engineering Document Production**: Independently handle advanced engineering tasks, conduct detailed electrical design under senior supervision, and execute computations for electrical systems. Leverage tools like AutoCAD and Revit for visual representation and oversee sequence of operations.
* **Pre-Construction Activity Direction:** Conduct building surveys, draft technical reports based on findings, and accumulate necessary data. Take charge of project design documentation and overall construction document preparations.
* **Construction Activity Supervision:** Collaborate within the engineering team, liaise closely with project management, and interact with clients on technical matters. Oversee the review of shop drawings, RFIs, and ensure completion of project closeout documents.
* **Reporting & Documentation:** Prepare periodic project reports for stakeholders, maintain RFI and shop drawing logs, manage personal work hours using company tools, and ensure punctual completion of assigned tasks and deliverables.

**Requirements (Intermediate level for all):**

* Comprehensive knowledge of building electrical systems, inclusive of power distribution phases, lighting controls, grounding, and safety systems, coupled with familiarity with key codes and specifications like the National Electric Code.
* Proficiency in technical/design software, emphasizing areas like short circuit coordination, arc flash studies, and equipment sizing.
* Demonstrated skill in producing detailed visual aids using AutoCAD, Revit, and the MS Office Suite, paired with exceptional organizational acumen.
* Adeptness in code analysis for equipment selection and wiring, with a focus on meeting essential code requirements.
* Demonstrated ability to produce accurate assignments, work efficiently in remote settings, and communicate effectively both in writing and verbally, even with clients.
* Capacity to effectively collaborate within teams, handle multiple tasks simultaneously, work under stringent timelines, and delegate tasks prudently.
* Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering and minimum of five years of electrical engineering experience

**Physical Demands:**

Handling of technical tools and equipment, maintaining a stationary position for extended periods, and traversing various site environments, including navigating stairs and ladders

**Travel/Relocation:**

Low travel to any of the 50 US states

**Perks & Benefits:**

* Comprehensive medical plans with HRA and FSA options, Dental and vision plans
* 401k with company match, self-directed brokerage account option
* PTO, including extra time off during the last week of the year
* Paid parental leave, professional development opportunities, and tuition reimbursement

DLB Associates is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and participates in the E-Verify program with the Department of Homeland Security. We encourage diversity in our workforce.

Are you ready to challenge yourself and redefine standards in the AEC industry? Apply now and join our award-winning team!

title: Electrical Engineer - Solar
description:
Stellavise is looking for talented engineers to join our rapidly growing firm and help shape the future of solar design. You will work on cutting edge solar and BESS projects in the utility scale market while helping to accelerate the growth of renewable energy!

The renewable market is expected to quadruple in size over the next 10 years and we need engineers with electrical system knowledge who are ready for the challenge of learning and designing solar and BESS farms. We can help convert your existing electrical skills into a career in renewables that will make an impact on future generations.

**Your Mission:** Assist in the creation of electrical drawings to produce clear and correct plan sets for green technology energy projects.

**Responsibilities:**

* Design commercial and utility scale solar PV systems (1MW to 500MW+)
* Layout solar and BESS farms to maximize production-Perform electrical calculations to size equipment, cables, conduits, etc.-Model solar and BESS systems in ETAP, CYMCAP and WinIGS
* Identify, formulate and produce effective solutions to emerging problems
* Assist with day to day operations of a small company
* Additional duties as needed

**Requirements:**

* At least 1 year of experience designing electrical systems (MEP or similar)
* Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering (ABET Accredited)
* Basic knowledge of power systems
* Familiarity with NEC
* Experience working with AutoCAD with an understanding of layer control, dimensions and scaling, sheet sets, blocks, xrefs, line weights, plot files, and file transmission.
* High Intelligence with the ability to retain new information and solve problems
* Detail oriented and produces high quality work
* Efficient and can stay on task
* Effective teamwork skills

**Preferred:**

* Engineer-in-Training Certificate or Professional Engineer
* Solar Design Experience

We believe our employees are our most important asset. We encourage professional and personal development and try to make the workplace an enjoyable environment. We provide a competitive compensation package including:

* Nine-day, 80-hour work schedule (every other Friday off)
* 2 weeks PTO with potential to increase
* Paid Holidays: US Bank Holidays
* Additional Paid Closures: day after Thanksgiving, workdays between Christmas and New Years
* Remote Work
* Competitive Salary (DOE)
* 100% coverage of Employee Benefits, including Health, Dental, and Life Insurance​
* 401k Retirement Plan with Employer Contribution of 3%

title: Electrical/Robotics Engineer
description:
**Honda has a clear vision for the future in 2030, and it’s a joyful one. We are looking for people with the individual skills, courage, persistence, and dreams that will help us reach our future-focused goals. We are seeking diversity of thought and experience to drive innovation and help us make fully informed decisions.**
In this role, you will be responsible for;
Leading activities related to equipment and robotics characteristic improvement for the Marysville Weld Department. This will be accomplished by performing true root cause analysis of top problems and implementing countermeasures. This will also be accomplished by evaluating current technical associate’s skill level, understanding department skill level needs, and developing and executing training plans to close the skill gap. The goal is to facilitate department S, Q, and D metric target achievement.


At Honda, our associates take pride in their responsibilities. A typical day for an **Electrical/Robotics Engineer** will include:
*Manufacturing Equipment Expert-*Equipment and robot top problem root cause analysis and permanent countermeasure.


*Training Management-*Understand skill level requirements for the department. Develop plans and strategies needed to improve technical skill level within the department.


*New Technology-*Use manufacturing expertise to support company’s development of new processes.

  

  

We are looking for qualified people with diverse backgrounds and experiences, open minds, and a disciplined work ethic. To bring the future to Honda as an **Electrical/Robotics Engineer** you must have:


**Qualifications;*** Bachelor’s degree in electrical/robotics engineering
* 0-6 years of engineering experience based on education
* Ability to interact in a team environment
  

***Knowledge and Skills**** MS Office proficiency
* Robot Programming, Robot System Setup and Troubleshooting, Robot Vision Guidance, Robot Safety Systems & Virtual Teaching Programs
* Systems design, service, and troubleshooting skills
* Effective communication and presentation skills

  


**Additional Position Information**
* Work at the spot, in the factory.
* 50% Office environment, 50% Production Floor environment.
* Some work to be performed on 2nd and 3rd shift depending on training needs.
* About 2 weeks of travel domestic and international and 300-500 hours of OT annually

  


**Total Rewards;**
* Competitive Base Pay
* Medical, Dental, Vision
* Remote Work Opportunities
* Bonus Program
* 401K Program
* Honda Product Programs
* Company Car Program


Honda is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected factor.

title: Electrical Engineer
description:
**Jerry Pittman is hiring fully remote Electrical Engineers. This position requires US citizenship or Permanent Resident status. There are no sponsorships available.**  
DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES:

* Responsible for complex design calculations and drawing development for the construction, maintenance, and repair of maritime vessels and shipboard systems including structural, propulsion, electrical, and hydraulic mechanics.
* Ensuring vessel design is in compliance with relevant regulatory authorities, specifications and customer requirements.
* Responsible for the technical management of design and analyses projects from concept to completion.
* Reviews drawings for compliance, accuracy and ease of production.
* Liaise with production and provide technical support during construction.
* Directs engineers, designers and drafters, engineering consultants, and/or vendors in the development of vessel design information.
* Works with production and project teams to successfully implement vessel and vessel component designs.
* Facilitates training, mentoring, and developing other engineers.
* Provides work leadership and direction to other engineers.
* Complies with employee handbook general guidelines, company procedures and policies.

QUALIFICATIONS / KNOWLEDGE / EXPERIENCE:

* General: 3 to 8 years of relevant engineering experience in the manufacturing, construction (or similar) industry, shipbuilding industry strongly preferred Excellent written and oral communication skills Possesses strong leadership skills, Ability to help grow company culture Understanding of scheduling and an ability to adhere to strict deadlines Experienced in interacting with Production, multiple design teams from several companies, customer representatives and equipment manufacturers Proficient in the use of AutoCAD, and MS Office products
* Preferred:Experienced in Steel and Aluminum Ship Construction Knowledge and application of modular construction methods Strong working knowledge of Maritime Regulatory Authorities (i.e. ABS, NAVSEA, MIL, USCG, IMO, etc.) Demonstrated experience in the design and construction of US Navy vessels Strong working knowledge of shock design Strong working knowledge of FEA methods, experience with FEMAP / NASTRAN a plus Strong working knowledge of composite shafting

Electrical Engineer Specific Requirements:

* Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or related engineering degree
* Thorough knowledge of power distribution, motor controllers, variable frequency drives, lighting systems, and communication systems
* Experience with managing Electric Plant Load Analysis, Short Circuit Analysis, Voltage Drop, and Breaker Coordination Studies
* Thorough knowledge of IEEE standards, ABS rules, IEC standards, SOLAS, Military Specifications, and/or NEC

ADDITIONAL GUIDELINES:  
All candidates must meet basic employment eligibility guidelines:

* The ability to obtain and maintain a DoD clearance may be required if deemed necessary in the scope of your position responsibilities.

title: Energy Engineer
description:
**ENERGY SYSTEMS GROUP****®** is looking for an **Energy** **Engineer** to join our Corporate Measurement and Verification Team. The position will be virtual. Regular travel (approximately 40%), including overnight stays dependent on project(s) location is required.


The Energy Engineer is responsible for the development of energy baselines, verifying energy saving and annual M&V reporting. The Energy Engineer will be knowledgeable in application of energy saving strategies, statistical analysis, and application of Government Agency specific guidance. The position requires strong analytical and critical thinking capabilities to address best practices in baseline development as well as performance period energy consumption evaluation.


**The essential functions of the position include:**

* Proactively reviews and/or interprets problems or patterns related to utility bills and energy consumption to limit risk and ensure a high level of customer satisfaction. As appropriate, solves issues or elevates to appropriate senior M&V engineering members for team review and resolution
* Owns and manages tools & processes that ensure timely collection and accurate data entry of utility bills or other monitored consumption sources for M&V portfolios
* Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical customers both internal and external
* Understanding of Federal Energy Management Program (FEMP) and International Performance Measurement and Verification Protocol (IPMVP) concept and guiding principles
* Lead/support development of customer baselines or benchmarks as needed
* Responsible for the creation of high quality / high value performance reports that convey added value and analysis of cost reduction to contract specifications and/or guarantees (Options A, B, C, D and Non-Measured Savings) to the client


**Your background includes:**


* Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or other technical field, or 3+ years proven track record of performance in Mechanical Systems data collection/operation & building systems or operations
* Strong statistical analysis and excellent interpersonal communication, analytical and sound business writing skills required


**A bonus to have:**


* Certified Energy Manager (CEM) and/or Certified Measurement and Verification Professional (CMVP)


**What we bring to you:**


* Professional growth and development programs including tuition reimbursement
* Comprehensive health and wellness plans for you and your family
* 401(k) Savings Plan
* Paid holidays and paid time off
* Highly competitive salaries and incentive structure


**We want you to know:**


ESG is an Equal Opportunity employer dedicated to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. We value talent and understand that our colleagues allow us the opportunity to deliver an exceptional customer experience. We achieve our goals through teamwork and conduct our business with integrity.


Join our world-class team to provide safe, reliable innovative energy efficiency and infrastructure solutions for K-12 schools and universities to local, state, and federal government agencies and more.


**This contractor and subcontractor shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR §§ 60-1.4(a), 60-300.5(a), and 60-741.5(a). These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin. Moreover, these regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disability.**


#LI-Remote

title: Autonomy Systems Engineer - Perception & Prediction
description:
**Mission Summary:**



Join us and help us solve some of the most challenging technical problems facing the autonomous driving industry. You will help redefine safe transportation by directly contributing to Motional's driverless future.



As part of our Perception-Prediction autonomy systems team, you will use systematic analysis and empirical methods to understand the performance of Motional's perception and prediction models, and their impact on the comfort and safety of the driverless vehicle. You will help improve and validate the robustness, performance, and safety of our driverless vehicle.


**What you'll be doing:**


* You will work with our detection, tracking, and prediction teams to improve perception and prediction evaluation pipelines. You will help derive performance targets and metrics that ensure driverless safety, while delivering performance and comfort
* Help establish methods to validate perception and prediction subsystems against our driverless readiness criteria, which you will help define
* Develop methods to improve the performance of existing online and offline perception and prediction pipelines, and collaborate cross-functionally to understand, document, and make tradeoffs between potential solutions
* You will become comfortable with our development tool chain to perform hands-on tests and analyses to identify issues and/or weaknesses in our system and recommend potential solutions. You will derive offline solutions to improve the model performance, and online solutions to monitor and mitigate any hazard associated with the weaknesses. If interested, you will take part in implementing those solutions
* Write reusable, high quality, data analysis software or models to enable accurate, efficient, and scalable analysis and data driven decisions
* Define and strategize interfaces between Autonomous Vehicle system modules; generating design strategies to maintain useful abstraction barriers between components. Over time, you will expand the scope of your systems engineering to broader aspects of the AV
* Articulate decisions and their rationales to drive cross system alignments and/or partner team implementations


**What we're looking for:**

  

* MS in Computer Science, Robotics, Electrical Engineering, Physics, or a related field with 2 years of professional experience in owning the technical responsibility over a complex system, preferably a machine learning based perception subsystem. Alternatively, a BS in Engineering with 4 years of professional experience in owning the technical responsibility over a complex system preferably a perception sub-system
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
* Excellent communication skills; effective in engaging cross teams for problem solving
* Highly proficient in Python
* Interested in and comfortable working with C, C++ software
* Familiar with core ML algorithm concepts and best practices


**Bonus points:**


* Ph.D. in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering, Robotics, Computer Science or a related field
* Experience with computer vision, or perception systems with different sensing modalities such as camera, lidar or radar
* Experience in developing, integrating, and/or validating machine learning based perception models
* Industry research or production experience
* Experience in high performance and real-time computing systems
* Experience with UML, simulation tools, SQL, Matlab
* Experience with professional software development


**Why you should join us:**



You will experience a fast paced working environment where you'll be challenged to find new ways of thinking. Your colleagues are eager for fresh ideas to address the challenging problems still to be solved.



Our team is commercializing a world-class driverless system. The Motional team is behind some of the industry's largest leaps forward in the last decade, including the first fully-autonomous cross-country drive in the U.S, the launch of the world's first robotaxi pilot, and operation of the world's most-established public robotaxi fleet. Strategically formed by Hyundai Motor Group and Aptiv, Motional is fundamentally changing how people move through their lives. We value diversity, equity, and inclusion and provide a supportive work environment that prioritizes collaboration, communication, and creativity. Our team members are committed to delivering high-quality results that make a real difference in the world. If you are passionate about the future of autonomous vehicles and want to work with a team of talented and motivated professionals, we encourage you to apply to join our team. Additionally, we offer excellent benefits to include generous medical plans, wellness benefits, unlimited PTO, 401k and equity, to name a few.


**Working conditions:**


* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to convey and detect communication
* The employee occasionally required to remain stationary at times for up to 50% of working time, move in designated working areas; & operate and use office equipment
* The employee may occasionally move up to 50 pounds


The Motional global headquarters are located at 100 Northern Avenue in Boston, MA. Nestled in the bustling Seaport district with sweeping views of Boston Harbor and downtown Boston, the offices are located close to major transit lines and a quick walk to various restaurants and popular attractions.



This position can support remote work in the US only.

  

The salary range for this role is an estimate based on a wide range of compensation factors including but not limited to specific skills, experience and expertise, role location, certifications, licenses, and business needs. The estimated compensation range listed in this job posting reflects base salary only. This role may include additional forms of compensation such as a bonus or company equity. The recruiter assigned to this role can share more information about the specific compensation and benefit details associated with this role during the hiring process.



Candidates for certain positions are eligible to participate in Motional's benefits program. Motional's benefits include but are not limited to medical, dental, vision, 401k with a company match, health saving accounts, life insurance, pet insurance, and more.


**Salary Range**


$131,000—$170,750 USD**Motional is a driverless technology company making autonomous vehicles a safe, reliable, and accessible reality. We're driven by something more.**


**Our journey is always people first.**



We aren't just developing driverless cars; we're creating safer roadways, more equitable transportation options, and making our communities better places to live, work, and connect. Our team is made up of engineers, researchers, innovators, dreamers and doers, who are creating a technology with the potential to transform the way we move.


**Higher purpose, greater impact.**



We're creating first-of-its-kind technology that will transform transportation. To do so successfully, we must design for everyone in our cities and on our roads. We believe in building a great place to work through a progressive, global culture that is diverse, inclusive, and ensures people feel valued at every level of the organization. Diversity helps us to see the world differently; it's not only good for our business, it's the right thing to do.


**Scale up, not starting up.**



Our team is behind some of the industry's largest leaps forward, including the first fully-autonomous cross-country drive in the U.S, the launch of the world's first robotaxi pilot, and operation of the world's longest-standing public robotaxi fleet. We're driven to scale; we're moving towards commercialization of our technology, and we need team members who are ready to embrace change and challenges.



Formed as a joint venture between Hyundai Motor Group and Aptiv, Motional is fundamentally changing how people move through their lives. Headquartered in Boston, Motional has operations in the U.S and Asia. For more information, visit www.Motional.com and follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram and YouTube.

  


*Motional AD Inc. is an EOE. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. To comply with Federal Law, we participate in E-Verify. All newly-hired employees are queried through this electronic system established by the DHS and the SSA to verify their identity and employment eligibility.*

title: Electrical Engineer - Relay Settings and Design - Cybirical
description:
We’d love to have you join our team as a Relay Settings Engineer as a remote employee, preferably in Louisiana.  
**Company Overview:**  
Through the application of engineering principles, we are modernizing the power grid at Cybirical for a safer, greener, more resilient tomorrow. As a professionally licensed engineering firm, we specialize in services and solutions for the design and maintenance of safe, secure, and cyber-aware power system environments.  
Our team of licensed power system engineers, certified information assurance professionals, security analysts, and software developers bring multiple disciplines together under one roof, allowing us to provide system focused services and solutions. We are 100% focused on the power industry and the systems and business processes used to maintain power system environments. No general ICS stuff here.  
Cybirical is an affiliate company of Ampirical. Working at Ampirical and Cybirical is a career, not just a job. Please enjoy **this video** about our culture.  
**Job Summary**  
The power system relay settings engineer is responsible for protective relay design (protective relay one-lines and schematics), protective relay setting coordination, development and calculations. This candidate will be interfacing with clients, vendors, and contractors related with technical matters and project scopes. In addition, this candidate will be working with other engineering and project management teams to coordinate overall project deliverables and maintain project budgets and schedules.  
**What we Offer:**  
We offer a highly competitive compensation & benefits package for all full-time employees. You can review all of the details of our benefits package **here**. Below are some highlights.  
The salary range for this position is $85,000 - Commensurate, depending on relevant experience, education, and qualifications. We also offer profit sharing bonuses to share in the mutual success!

* Medical, Dental, and Vision effective your 1st day of employment
* 401(k) with company match (immediate vesting)
* 120 hours (about 15 days) of paid time off (PTO)
* 10 paid holiday days
* Flexible work schedule (every other Friday off)
* Opportunity for advancement and career growth
* Employer-sponsored Life Insurance, short-term and long-term Disability Insurance
* Gym Membership Stipend
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Wellness Program
* Pet Insurance
* Fertility Benefits

**Who You Are**

* Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering from an ABET accredited university with preferred emphasis on power.
* Knowledge and understanding of one or more of the following skillsets: SCADA, automation, relay settings, RTU configuration, and Protection & Controls engineering terms and concepts are a plus.
* Experience working with the electric utility industry or petro-chemical industry.
* Skills with CAPE, ASPEN, ETAP, Relay vendors softwares

**Essential Duties & Responsibilities**

* Responsible for executing Protection and Control Engineering and Consulting services in Transmission and Distribution engineering in the electric grid.
* Programming, testing, and commissioning protection and control related applications for power system design and substation automation projects.
* Design and delivery of complex protection solutions for generation, transmission, distribution systems for electrical utilities and industrial customers
* Perform engineering studies and analyses such as: short circuit, load flow, ground grid, arc-flash protective device coordination, etc.
* Develop relay setting files to include programming of protection and control Logic and communications settings protective relays.
* Perform configuration of RTU and other substation protection related devices as needed.
* Participate in project meetings with project managers and customers on technical discussions.

**EEO Statement:**  
Cybirical is an Equal Opportunity Employer, meaning we do not discriminate based on the following characteristics in our hiring and employment practices: Age, sex, color, race, creed, national origin, religion or religious attire, marital status, pregnancy (child birth or related medical conditions), citizenship status or amnesty, ancestry, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, genetic information, sickle-cell trait, status as a tobacco user or non-user, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law.
