title: Propulsion Engineer
description:
We are a multinational group with over 100 years of experience in the supply of comprehensive transit solutions positioned at the forefront of technology for high value-added sustainable mobility.


The company is a leader of the railway industry offering one of the most comprehensive and flexible arrays of products in railway related markets, such as rolling stock, components, infrastructure, signalling and services (maintenance, refurbishing and financial services).


The **Systems Engineer** will be involved in all technical activities necessary to ensure the systems design is compliant to customer requirements and applicable law and standards, managing sub-suppliers equipment design, its integration and the verification and validation of the solutions. He/She will actively take part in the design enhancements needed to solve problems that arise during production, testing and commissioning.


The System Engineer will be involved in the implementation, verification and validation process for Indian and International tender and project design processes. This design process will include all activities necessary to obtain the approval from the customer and necessary authorities to the arquitecture, design solutions, and related document  

of the specific systems, test protocols, etc.  

The area of expertise required is in Electrical Traction and Energy Systems (system Engineer)

**KEY RESPONSABILITIES:**


RESPONSABILITIES:  

* To be part of the specific design team for each module, even participating in design revisions with end customer.
* To be responsible (shared with the specific experts in CAF headquarters) of the acceptance process of the design (including arquitectures, design solutions, documents, etc.)
* To generate necessary documentation oriented to Customer Design Revisions and Approval process, to provide quick answers to the customer, obtain on time answers from them as well as to anticipate the validation of documents (validation of comments from customer prior to receiving official letters).

  

ACTIVITIES:  

* Review design solutions that are under design, revisit contractual requirements, applicable standards, to crosscheck the correct definition of these solutions.
* Active Participation in the Functional definition and revision process of the corresponding System, with customer and suppliers, at Tender and project phase.
* Prepare meetings with customer with CAF headquarters' teams (who also assist and lead the technical discussions) and assist to the meeting. After these preparation meetings, to generate the ppt files for the official meeting with custome. Write MoM and deal with Open Points of the meetings.
* Receive, analyze and provide first quick answers to the comments/questions received from customer.
* Technical management of supplier of the corresponding System: documentation exchange, requirements compliance, verification and validation process, …
* Generate documentation for the design review of the affected System or module, and for the Homologation process, at Tender and project phase.
* Complete de requirement management lifecycle: revision, implementation, traceability, verification&validation, closure.
* Define the validation process of the corresponding System: definition of test procedures, participation in tests,
* Participate/Lead the validation process of the related subsystem, check the compliance of applicable requirements, analyze the results, close requirements, …
* Participate/lead the projects in a global way (with the assistance of CAF Headquarters) in matters of quality, cost and planning… identifying any kind of risk to be mitigated and also opportunities for the correct development of the project.
* Participate/lead the offer processes that CAF considers to participate in a global way (with the assistance of CAF Headquarters) in matters of quality, cost andplanningidentifying any kind of risk to be mitigated and also opportunities for the correct development of the project.
* Participate/lead the projects and offers in order to achieve a complete electrical, mechanical and SW integration of all the Doors and LoadiPropulsion and Energy systems in the vehicle.

**KEY RESPONSABILITIES:**


RESPONSABILITIES:  

* To be part of the specific design team for each module, even participating in design revisions with end customer.
* To be responsible (shared with the specific experts in CAF headquarters) of the acceptance process of the design (including arquitectures, design solutions, documents, etc.)
* To generate necessary documentation oriented to Customer Design Revisions and Approval process, to provide quick answers to the customer, obtain on time answers from them as well as to anticipate the validation of documents (validation of comments from customer prior to receiving official letters).

  

ACTIVITIES:  

* Review design solutions that are under design, revisit contractual requirements, applicable standards, to crosscheck the correct definition of these solutions.
* Active Participation in the Functional definition and revision process of the corresponding System, with customer and suppliers, at Tender and project phase.
* Prepare meetings with customer with CAF headquarters' teams (who also assist and lead the technical discussions) and assist to the meeting. After these preparation meetings, to generate the ppt files for the official meeting with custome. Write MoM and deal with Open Points of the meetings.
* Receive, analyze and provide first quick answers to the comments/questions received from customer.
* Technical management of supplier of the corresponding System: documentation exchange, requirements compliance, verification and validation process, …
* Generate documentation for the design review of the affected System or module, and for the Homologation process, at Tender and project phase.
* Complete de requirement management lifecycle: revision, implementation, traceability, verification&validation, closure.
* Define the validation process of the corresponding System: definition of test procedures, participation in tests, …
* Participate/Lead the validation process of the related subsystem, check the compliance of applicable requirements, analyze the results, close requirements, …
* Participate/lead the projects in a global way (with the assistance of CAF Headquarters) in matters of quality, cost and planning… identifying any kind of risk to be mitigated and also opportunities for the correct development of the project.
* Participate/lead the offer processes that CAF considers to participate in a global way (with the assistance of CAF Headquarters) in matters of quality, cost andplanning…identifying any kind of risk to be mitigated and also opportunities for the correct development of the project.
* Participate/lead the projects and offers in order to achieve a complete electrical, mechanical and SW integration of all the Doors and LoadiPropulsion and Energy systems in the vehicle.

**CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS:**

**Qualification:**

* Bachelor or Master Degree in Mechannical or Electrical Engineering.

**Professional Experience:**

* Experienced (a minimum of 3 years) in railway sector in System Engineering,  

	+ Knowledge in the Indian market and Approval process.
	+ Experience in management of Electrical Traction and Energy systems suppliers
	+ Experience in Validation process of Electrical Traction systems.

**Skills:**

* Good skills to communicate and work in group.
* Adaptability to a fast-evolving environment.
* Strictness but fitting to defined and given methodology and instructions.
* Good skills with Excell, Word, Outlook, PPT, Microsoft Project, etc…


To have used in the pass and be familiarised with tools such as DOORs, CATIA, 3DExperience, TRELLO, Program Planner.* Language: High English language skills, both written and spoken. (Spanish, as alternative, would be favorably considered).
* Availability for frequent travelling within India and also to Headquarters in Spain.


Ability to build a network of collaborators within India.

title: Technical Support Engineer
description:
**About Avaya**
---------------



Businesses are built by the experiences they provide, and every day, millions of those experiences are delivered by Avaya. Organizations trust Avaya to provide innovative solutions for some of their most important ambitions and challenges, giving them the freedom to engage their customers and employees in ways that deliver the greatest business benefits.



Avaya contact center and communications solutions help power immersive, personalized, and unforgettable customer experiences that drive business momentum. With the freedom to choose their journey, there’s no limit to the experiences Avaya customers can create.



The richness of Avaya’s global team diversity is our greatest strength, and we are committed to being a workplace where authenticity and individuality are celebrated and different perspectives are embraced. Learn more at www.avaya.com.

**Job Information**
-------------------



Job Code: 00255942


Job Family: Services


Job Function: Services Engineering

**Short Description**
---------------------



An individual contributor who provides advanced remote post-sales support of software and/or hardware systems, sub-systems and/or applications for customers or field personnel utilizing telephone and remote diagnostic capabilities. Provides support for medium to highly complex end user installations, configurations, upgrades and migrations through advanced problem solving and troubleshooting. Includes supporting 3rd party products and occasional on-site support. Analyzes symptoms, logs, and data required to resolve issues of medium to high complexity. Independently determines and develops approaches to solutions. Proactive in monitoring and resolving low complexity downstream effects as a result of the fix. May highlight more complex issues. Displays an understanding of the functionality and usage of the product and in conjunction with associated product.

**Experience**
--------------


3 - 4 Years of Experience**Education**
-------------


Bachelor degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering**Preferred Certifications**
----------------------------


**Footer**
----------


Avaya is an Equal Opportunity employer and a U.S. Federal Contractor. Our commitment to equality is a core value of Avaya. All qualified applicants and employees receive equal treatment without consideration for race, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran or any other protected characteristic. In general, positions at Avaya require the ability to communicate and use office technology effectively. Physical requirements may vary by assigned work location. This job brief/description is subject to change. Nothing in this job description restricts Avaya right to alter the duties and responsibilities of this position at any time for any reason. You may also review the Avaya Global Privacy Policy (accessible at https://www.avaya.com/en/privacy/policy/) and applicable Privacy Statement relevant to this job posting (accessible at https://www.avaya.com/en/documents/info-applicants.pdf).

title: Development Operations Engineer
description:
**This is where you save and sustain lives**


At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You'll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.


Baxter's products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.


Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work.


Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives—where your purpose accelerates our mission.

**Posting Title: Senior Engineer Dev Ops,** **GSS & PSS**

**Your Role at Baxter:**


Provide technical or infra leadership to effectively define, design, execute Devops strategy and drive quality assurance for new and existing components of the GSS/PSS portfolio.


This position is based out of Bangalore.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**


<>·<>·Stay abreast of innovation and new technologies in DevOps, CI/CD, test automation and test methodologies.

* Establishes a performance monitoring and metrics-driven methodology that ensures speed and uptime of all applications and infrastructure are quantified, tracked, and managed.
* Establishing the build, test environment working closely with global teams.
* Work closely with software engineers, Architect, Product Owner, and other stakeholders throughout the full software development lifecycle starting from product concept till maintenance.
* Drive the initiative to simplify the developer and tester operational problems.

**Your Team:**


You will be part of the GSS & PSS team in Bangalore. This position does not have any direct reports. You will need to work collaboratively with R&D and cross functions.

**Your Location:**


The role is located in the BRD facility in Bangalore India.

**What You’ll Bring:**

* Bachelors / Master’s in computer science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering or related field.
* 6 to 10 years of related experience.
* Expertise and hands-on experience in DevOps, Automation, Microservices, Containerization, PAAS, IaaS, Build and Release Engineering, Configuration Management, Cloud Infrastructure Automation includes Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services (AWS).
* Strong experience in Deployment vis the Azure platform implementation including Security, Compute, Containers, Storage, Azure Network
* Experience with Azure Repos, branching, code review and code analysis tools.
* Hands-on experience with various DevOps tools and technologies, including Azure, Kubernetes, Docker, Helm, Jira, or Git source control and build tools.
* experience in IT Infrastructure & Azure / AWS Cloud designing, and delivering complex Infra & Cloud Solutions
* Expert in Helm charts - packaging the module and deploying through Helm, managing repositories, secretes, custom helm charts etc.
* Strong knowledge and experience on Azure PaaS and IaaS services such as Azure Storage account, Azure File Shares, Azure Virtual machines management and deployment
* Work with developers & Cloud Infra team to identify necessary Application infrastructure.
* Design & implementation of application hosting environment in Azure Kubernetes service, Container, Azure VM & Azure PaaS using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) Tools like Terraform, Ansible etc
* Experience with Azure Repos, branching, code review and code analysis tools (static and vulnerability)
* Strong experience Git, git-lab, bit-bucket, JIRA, Confluence etc
* Knowledge of scripting languages such as PowerShell, Bash
* Knowledge of Linux, Windows server, Monitoring tools, and Shell scripting

**Good to have: -**

* DevOps lead with expertise in Azure pipelines, defining DevOps strategies, branching merging strategies, experience with PowerShell & Bash
* Expert in Azure Cloud - service bus, CosmosDb, its configurations, event management, App services, Azure management SQL etc.
* Excellent troubleshooting skills in Azure cloud. Solid conceptual understanding of infrastructure and technology stack for achieving HA and DR ready implementations.
* Advanced understanding of core TCP/IP v4 network concepts to provide in segregated network environment (intranet/DMZ/extranets).
* This would include understanding of DNS, routing, load balancing, firewall/ACLs, etc.
* Self-motivated with good interpersonal skills.
* Good team player to achieve team goals.

*Baxter is committed to supporting the needs for flexibility in the workplace. We do so through our flexible workplace policy which includes a minimum of 3 days a week onsite. This policy provides the benefits of connecting and collaborating in-person in support of our Mission*

**Reasonable Accommodations**  

  

Baxter is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities globally. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please click on the link here and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

**Recruitment Fraud Notice**  

  

Baxter has discovered incidents of employment scams, where fraudulent parties pose as Baxter employees, recruiters, or other agents, and engage with online job seekers in an attempt to steal personal and/or financial information. To learn how you can protect yourself, review our Recruitment Fraud Notice.

title: Process Engineer
description:
Sandvik Manufacturing Solutions (SMF) is on an exciting growth journey, building the new digital era of manufacturing, and we have the know-how and innovative mindset to develop ideas into pioneering tech solutions. As a business area segment within Sandvik Group, SMF incorporates the three divisions of Design & Planning Automation, Additive Manufacturing and Industrial Metrology.
SigmaNEST one of the growing business units within SMF is the leading provider of innovative end-to-end CAD/CAM software solutions to help professional fabricators increase ROI by optimizing material utilization, machine motion, manpower, and data management. SigmaNEST is simply the best nesting software in the industry. With unmatched versatility and maximum scalability, the comprehensive product portfolio covers the full range of fabrication workflow; from quoting to shipping, including robust integration with a wide range of business systems.
The Role  

This person is responsible for developing new Post Processors and custom plugins, Editing old Post or plugins on AE’s request. Must have good communication skills to interact with global teams. Will be responsible to maintain post and plugin records, might need to travel onsite on request.
Job Title: Post Process Engineer (SigmaNEST)
Based at: Pune - Maharashtra – India
Work from office
Areas of responsibility:* Responsible for Post-development (Scripting of Post Processors) for all the machines posts for SigmaTEK India
* Responsible for Developing Plugins or Modifying developed plugins as per the requirement given by the customer
* Responsible for developing custom reports form software (Scripting part)
* Responsible for the delivering Posts/Plugins to the customer within the time frame allotted by the manager
* Might need to travel onsite if required but mostly shall be stationed at the office
* Develop new post processors to support CNC machines within our proprietary CAD/CAM software
* Build test cases, NC programs, and runoff parts for the post certification process for CNC machines
* Provide technical consultation to the software development, sales, and applications support departments regarding the capabilities, variations, and output requirements for the variety of supported CNC machines
* Modify and maintain existing customers post processors on an on-going basis
* Create accompanying post user documentation


Main Requirements:* Bachelor’s degree in computer science / mechanical / Industrial / Electrical Engineering, or related field
* 3 or more years of experience in Experience with programming in Delphi, C++, and C#
* Strong object-oriented programming skills is a must.
* Strong problem-solving skills
* English Communication
* Good communication and customer service skills
* Ability to work independently.
* Strong math skills
* Ability to travel up to 25% of the time.


A glimpse of our culture
At Sandvik, we're tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial! For us, success is a team effort - we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. We also give you the freedom to find that perfect mix between work, family life and interests. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.
How to apply?
As we have an ongoing selection process for this recruitment, we kindly ask you to Apply here directly. For more details visit: www.sigmanest.com/en

title: System Engineer
description:
Experienced System Design Engineer


**Location:**Bangalore, IN, 562122
**Position Type:** Professional  

Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.
**Who are we?**

We are Driver Security, Safety & Visibility Technology Area within Driver Interaction.
We are a bunch of highly passionate and skilled engineering organization that love our work and use our creativity to develop solutions on Driver Security, Safety & Visibility that creating value towards our customers and for society
**We have**
* a range of World class products to work which are sold worldwide
* a wide range of End user functions and products to explore and work with
* an open mind for new ideas and innovation
* a culture that encourages great place to grow
* great team of skilled engineers to work along
**On a typical day, you are**
* Part of self-organized scrum team
* Involved in developing the framework for driver Visibility specifications.
* Investigating system level or truck level issues and providing right solutions.
* Steer exploration of alternatives to establish a system level driver visibility concept together with the team.
* Defining and documenting Fault code specification
* Interacting with the Component Owner (CO) and Function Owner (FO) & SW developers
* Understanding the EUF’s impacted and have an agreement on the time-plan for specifications activity
* Understanding the ECU state flow machine and the behavior of the system in different vehicle modes
* Reviewing the signal definition
* Documenting of Logical design & related signals and requirements in system engineering tool
* Documenting of Application Network requirements in system engineering tool
* Doing System FMEA for different vehicle modes.
* Talking with your colleagues around the world
**Requirements**
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in electrical, electronic engineering (or similar) with 4 to 7Years of experience.
* Good understanding of automotive electrical systems and architecture
* Knowledge on block schematic or similar topology, which shows, overall power distribution and Grounding topology on vehicle level
* Hand-on knowledge knowledge of CAN, LIN, DOIP, J1939, J1587, UDS protocols
* Working knowledge in Application software diagnostics.
* Knowledge on current and upcoming vehicle regulations and emission norms.
* Hands-on experience in Function development in the field of System Engineering on automotive domain.
* Knowledge on vehicle security and anti-theft related system and components.
* Knowledge on Functional Safety (ISO26262) is a merit
* Should have used quality tools like SFMEA, DFMEA etc.
* Should has awareness on the application networks, ECU topologies
* Good in Team and cross functional work abilities

Good communication skills (written and verbal) in English is Mandatory  
* 
  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.  


**Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.  


Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.  


**Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.
**Job Category:** Technology Engineering
**Organization:** Group Trucks Technology
**Travel Required:** Occasional Travel
**Requisition ID:** 4640
**View All Jobs**


**Do we share the same aspirations?**


Every day, Volvo Group products and services ensure that people have food on the table, children arrive safely at school and roads and buildings can be constructed. Looking ahead, we are committed to driving the transition to sustainable and safe transport, mobility and infrastructure solutions toward a net-zero society.


Joining Volvo Group, you will work with some of the world’s most iconic brands and be part of a global and leading industrial company that is harnessing automated driving, electromobility and connectivity.


Our people are passionate about what they do, they aim for high performance and thrive on teamwork and learning. Everyday life at Volvo is defined by a climate of support, care and mutual respect.


If you aspire to grow and make an impact, join us on our journey to create a better and more resilient society for the coming generations.

title: Senior Engineer
description:
**Date:** Mar 6, 2024


**Location:** Chennai, TN, IN, 600113


**Company:** Hubbell Incorporated


**Brand Overview**
------------------

  

Hubbell Incorporated was founded in 1888 and has grown into an international manufacturer of quality electrical, lighting and power solutions with more than 75 brands used and recognized around the world. Our founder, Harvey Hubbell, developed tooling and equipment to serve the growing demand for new assembly and manufacturing machinery during the industrial revolution. An early, and one of many patents awarded, came for the creation of the first practical method to control electricity through the pull chain socket that remains unchanged today. As a market leader in reliable, electrical solutions, we provide more than half a million products delivered through our various business groups. Hubbell is committed to continually innovating solutions that work, transforming old products with new ideas, and ensuring that we Energize, Enlighten and Empower the communities that support us.  

  

India Operations  

  

BURNDY Technology and Global Business Services Private Limited (HUBBELL INDIA) is a wholly owned subsidiary of Hubbell Inc. Hubbell India provides Engineering Services, Business Solutions and IT Services. Hubbell Engineering located in Ascendas, ITPL,Chennai, is engaged in the business of computer aided design and engineering services. The Hubbell Business Solutions functions at Infopark Kochi, provide superior business intelligence, knowledge services and business process solutions across Hubbell divisions and Corporate. IT Services team is spread across Chennai and Kochi.  

  

Hubbell Electrical Products LLP located in Chennai is poised to assist with part and product manufacturing for all Hubbell Business units
**Posting Address**
-------------------

  

Burndy Technology & Global Business Services Pvt Ltd  

13th Floor, Zenith (Phase 3)  

International Tech Park ,CSIR Road  

Taramani, Chennai ,Tamil Nadu -600113
**Position Overview**
---------------------

  

We are looking for an Electro-mechanical Engineer who is good in basics of electrical engineering concepts and expertise in design and development of medium voltage protection and switching product line
**Duties and Responsibilities**
-------------------------------

  

* Interact with US clients to understand and gather project requirements.
* Lead design & development of Overhead medium voltage protection system/ sub-system as per marketing requirements.
* Research, review, and implement best-practices, new and emerging technologies, and design patterns to new and existing development.
* Generate conceptual 3D design, engineering calculations and detailed design for extensive range of electro-mechanical products using Autodesk Inventor.
* Converting the ideas into practically feasible product-oriented design.
* Validate the conceptual design integrity using FEA analysis.
* Deliver complete and accurate detailed design drawings as required for part manufacturing with GD&T.
* Create Drawings based on ASME Y14.5M – 1994 standards.
* Support for the electrical product testing with respect to IEEE standards.
* Generate documentation including design spec, part drawings, engineering bill of materials and assembly drawing per Hubbell standard.
* Working knowledge in Vault and SAP based engineering change management process.
* Knowledge on DFM and DFA is an added advantage.
**Skills and Experience**
-------------------------

  

Experience: Mandatory: Minimum 4 years’ experience in electrical industry dealing with medium voltage protection and switching products. Desired: Experience in independently leading a large size switchgear project from scratch to launch.
Software skills: Mandatory: Must have working knowledge in all the features of Autodesk Inventor & AutoCAD. Desired: Working knowledge in FEA software Ansys or COMSOL and PLM vault is desirable  


**Desired Skills:**
* Sound knowledge in designing medium voltage disconnecting switches and load break switches.
* Hands on experience in fault current interrupting products such as VCB/ACB or recloser or circuit breaker or fusing product design (any one preferred).
* Hands on experience in designing latch-based holding & actuating mechanism for VCB/ACB/recloser/capacitor switches (any one preferred).
* Knowledge in arc plasma physics and its interruption
* Knowledge in electro-mechanical and electro-magnetic assemblies.
* Basic knowledge in magnetics design & selection of electro-mechanical actuators like solenoids & Ct’s or transformers.
* Basic experience in fault breaking test, di-electric testing, short time withstand current test and its result interpretation.
**Education**
-------------


Masters Degree
Bachelors Degree in Electrical Engineering**Relevant Industries**
-----------------------


Power

title: Senior Engineer
description:
**Company Description**
-----------------------

**Ambitious Lead Electrical Engineer- High Voltage Direct Current (HVDC), Ramboll, Chennai**


Are you passionate about **concept, FEED & detailed engineering / EPIC** and do you want to be part of a large international consulting firm that is constantly developing where you will help organize your own tasks? Ramboll is looking for a **technically ambitious** and skilled **electrical engineer** for our Chennai location.

**Inviting bright minds**


Do you want to push the boundaries of your profession and develop your excellence in an open, collaborative and empowering culture? We work to create a sustainable future and our inspiring projects and innovative solutions aim to set the standard among our peers. You will join a global company that has been growing successfully since its founding in 1945. Together, we lead and leave a positive impact on societies, companies and people around the world.

**Great responsibility and professional sparring**


In Ramboll you will perform versatile and exciting tasks for large international companies. You will work independently and have your **own areas of responsibility**. At the same time, you will become part of **a highly professional environment** with talented and committed colleagues, where sparring is paramount.


Ramboll is a knowledge-based company where you, with your strong technical skills, contribute with valuable solutions while providing targeted sparring and establishing close professional relationships with colleagues and clients.


Your professional skills and wishes for personal development will be part of the organization of the tasks. In this way, you are helping to shape the way for an **interesting and challenging work life.**

**About the position**


We are looking for a Lead Electrical Engineer – HVDC to support our team within various business verticals of Energy Business Unit. We work on various areas like Wind, Offshore & Onshore Substations, etc.


The Energy Systems Spearhead within Energy Business unit is looking for a dynamic Specialist in High Voltage Direct Current field.


Key responsibilities, tasks & important relations


You shall be working with our technical team. The new position shall be our focal for HVDC and dynamic reactive compensation systems and providing technical leadership.

**Job Description**
-------------------

* Should have the experience of 15 to 20 or higher years in High voltage design out of which at least 5 to 7 years of experience in complete HVDC electrical system and equipment design, integration and interfacing engineering.
* Design / review and detailed engineering for complete HVDC electrical system including plant electrification, DC converter/ valves station, HV power lines, HV cables, transmission and distribution substations
* Technical leadership of all HVDC and dynamic reactive compensation equipment, with portfolio-wide Technical Authority across full asset lifetime.
* Work with dedicated engineering specialists establishing a framework of processes, guidelines and other resources to maximize operational efficiency of Engineering.
* Lead technical investigations on asset performance/optimisation and equipment failures across operational fleet. Act as proactive and visible Engineering link to all operational assets.
* Act as approving authority for technical documentation related to the design, construction, commissioning, and maintenance procedures across HVDC and dynamic reactive power compensation scope.
* Support Engineering Management in identifying competency and capability gaps within department and seek resourcing solutions (internal and external) to maintain and build range of technical capability.
* Act as technical ambassador for industry events/consultations relating to scope area.
* Support Package and Product Engineering to inject technical leadership into all stages of the project lifecycle. Control levels of technical variation within Product/Project portfolio and building learnings into standardisation strategy and processes.
* Act as a mentor for colleagues in scope area. Demonstrate technical leadership and extend influence beyond normal job responsibilities.
* Coordination and follow up of packages with system and equipment Vendors.
* Coordination with Transmission System Owner and substation owner / contractor, issue and follow up of CSS questionnaire.
* In this role as a technical lead, you will ensure that activities related to all engineering disciplines within the project are efficiently and cost-effectively executed in accordance with contract specifications, quality standards and safety requirements.
* As a technical lead for all engineering disciplines - evaluates, selects, and applies standard techniques, procedures and criteria to perform task or sequence of tasks, for HVDC projects across globe.
* Provide technical support in project installation and site activities, clarifying potential issues or providing solutions to correct engineering errors. Provides technical support to commissioning and start-up activities.
* Assists in creating proposals for HVDC projects in terms of proposal documents and engineering estimates (man hours, budget, and other method statements)
* Assists in performing engineering risk analysis including change management (in case of additional scope of work, cost impact, time impact, risk quantifications, etc.) for the proposals and projects.
* Create work plans and cost estimates in one's area of responsibility.
* Interacts with other Ramboll business unit focal/ lead engineer, customers, contractors, suppliers and attends project meetings and presents all technical aspects of project assignments.
* Collaborates and networks with engineering colleagues within Ramboll and shares best practice across different projects and disciplines.
* Review / Preparation and evaluation of general project documentation in addition to engineering deliverables.
* Handling multi discipline task-oriented projects.
* Experienced in parametric modelling of cables, transformers, converters and other electrical Equipment in simulation tools for the complete HVDC system.
* Experienced in performing technical, economic and environmental studies
* Knowledge of various international standards like IEC, IEEE/ANSI, BS, CIGRE, DNV standards for high voltage and medium voltage system and equipment.
* Skilled user of Microsoft office – Excel, Word
* Experience within the design of HVDC plants / stations on the following:
	+ Control boards for HVDC systems
	+ Control, Interlocks, Trip Matrix, logics and monitoring
	+ Relay protection and Metering for high voltage systems
	+ Components for high voltage systems
	+ SCADA and other communication architecture
* Inspection at the production site/site of components and assembly
* Participation in relevant tests at suppliers and at the production site/site.
* Follow-up of quality assurance documentation
**Qualifications**
------------------

**Important Relations.**

* HOD/Team Lead/Sr. Engineer & team
* Works with other engineers in the project team of REN EEC and DK team
* Works with HV Engineering counterparts in other REN offices

**Qualifications & Experience**

* Master/Bachelor of Electrical Engineering preferably high voltage engineering/ power electronics from recognized University
* Preparing / reviewing electrical design basis report, detailed study report, technical specifications and data sheets of HVDC electrical system and equipment.
* Experienced in power system simulation and studies of HVDC system by using any one of the software - PSCAD, DiGSILENT PowerFactory, PSSE and ETAP.
* Calculation of induced voltages due to nearby HV AC cables / Overhead lines
* Calculation of inductive and capacitive coupling
* Earthing and bonding concept including calculation of touch and step voltage
* Knowledge of fault condition in high voltage transmission grids
* Preparing / reviewing of magnetic field calculations using COMSOL, CDEGS, PSCAD and EMTP or similar software.
* Experience in the design of HV/ EHV substation projects including GIS / AIS (Primary and Secondary engineering)
* Designing various overhead power transmission, distribution lines, cables, magnetic field calculations including substation and lines at 33kV / 110kV / 132kV / 220kV / 230kV / 400kV / 765kV/ 1200kV.
* Experienced in overall HVDC electrical equipment arrangement layout, cable routing, illumination, grounding / earthing, lightning protection system design and layouts including preparation of Bill of Materials (MTO)
**Additional Information**
--------------------------

**Working at Ramboll**


To work at Ramboll means being part of a people organization. We are focused on knowledge sharing and collaboration across competence areas and geography, and we aim for a strong diversity among our employees. This enables us to solve a broad range of projects, and we firmly believe that cross-collaboration leads to creative and longstanding solutions. Thus, the possibilities at Ramboll are many and diverse –we invest a lot in the development of people and offer career paths tailored for each individual.

**Welcome to our Energy division**


Ramboll is at the forefront of addressing the green transition and offers a holistic approach to energy that supports the sector on the journey towards more sustainable solutions. With 1,800 experts in 14 countries, covering the full spectrum of technologies and all parts of the value chain from production and transmission to distribution, we plan, design and implement energy solutions all over the world.

**Ramboll in India**


Ramboll has more than 1,000 experts working across five offices in India applying their passion to deliver innovative solutions in markets as diverse as Buildings, Transport, Planning & Urban Design, Water, Environment & Health and Energy. Founded in Denmark, Ramboll is a people company. We invite you to contribute to a sustainable future working in an open, collaborative and empowering culture.

**How to apply**


If you are interested in applying, please send your application through our online recruitment system by clicking the link ‘apply’ below. Attach your CV, cover letter and relevant documents showcasing why you are the right fit for the role, and when you are available to start. We look forward to receiving your application.

title: Project Engineer
description:
**Associate Project Engineer**
==============================

#### **Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.**

  

You will be working as Associate Project Engineer and will be part of Process Automation business for division based in Bangalore, India. In this role you will be reporting to Engineering Manager and will be responsible for pre-commissioning protocols, commissioning protocols, commissioning check lists, safety checklists, load trial data, critical commissioning data, commissioning documents like no-load trial graphs, load trial graphs, parameter backup, software backup maintenance related document preparation.

### **Your responsibilities**

* Collaborating with concerned engineers and managers for smooth execution of projects
* Preparing and reviewing of basic engineering drawings like single line diagram, dimensional drawings, fabrication drawings etc
* Sizing or cross verification of the low voltage drives / motors as per application requirement
* Preparing of commissioning reports, warranty report of failed items
* Tracking of warranty reports and replacements and pending point closure
* Capturing customer complaints post commissioning and providing timely solution

### **Your background**

* Bachelor’s degree or diploma from a reputed university with first class in electrical / electrical and electronics engineering
* 2 to 5 years of relevant work experience in drives solutions by similar suppliers
* Experience of commissioning/ trouble shooting/ servicing drive systems preferably in/for metal industry and industrial cranes
* Knowledge of IT/ Network/ Peripherals like UPS, Printer, PC’s, Server components of DCS
* knowledge in application programming & HMI development/ modifications for PLC/ DCS systems
* Knowledge on different communication protocols used between PLC and drives or in automation

### **More about us**


Process Industries division delivers complete electrification and automation solutions, industry-specific products and lifecycle services across industries. Engineering and delivering automation solutions from device to monitoring and control make our customers get more out of their investment; digitalization solutions including collaborative operations and augmented reality help improve plant and enterprise productivity, reduce maintenance and energy costs. Our engineering, project management, services and solutions portfolio covers a wide range of industries - Mining, Pulp & Paper, Metals, Aluminum and Cement, Data centers and Food and Beverage We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com. It has come to our attention that the name of ABB is being used for asking candidates to make payments for job opportunities (interviews, offers). Please be advised that ABB makes no such requests. All our open positions are made available on our career portal for all fitting the criteria to apply. ABB does not charge any fee whatsoever for recruitment process. Please do not make payments to any individuals / entities in connection to recruitment with ABB, even if is claimed that the money is refundable. ABB is not liable for such transactions. For current open positions you can visit our career website https://global.abb/group/en/careers and apply. Please refer to detailed recruitment fraud caution notice using the link https://global.abb/group/en/careers/how-to-apply/fraud-warning. Work model: on site #LI-onsite

title: Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------

  

Designs, develops, and builds analog circuits in advanced process nodes for analog and mixedsignal IPs. Designs floorplans, performs circuit design, extracts chip parameters, and simulates analog behavior models. Creates test plans to verify design according to circuit and block microarchitecture specifications and evaluates test results. Verifies functionality to optimize circuit for power, performance, area, timing, and yield goals. Collaborates cross functionally to report design progress and collects, tracks, and resolves any performance and circuit design issues. Optimizes performance, power, area, and reduces leakage of circuits. Works with architecture and layout team to design circuit for best functionality, robustness, and electrical capabilities.  

**Qualifications**
------------------

  

Desired Skills and Experience:Looking for a candidate with BE plus 8 years of experience OR ME with 6 years of experience in analog design and developmentExperience in designing analog and mixed-signal circuits in standard CMOS technologies such as op-amps, comparators, bandgap references, linear regulators etcExperience with backend performance and reliability verification tools including Monte Carlo, EMIR, static/dynamic MOSFET voltage checks, etcUnderstanding of switching voltage regulators such as Buck converters is a plus.Post-Si debug experience and experience of productizing design in high volume production is a plus.Expected to perform well in a fast-paced collaborative team environment, to execute to meet our customer commitment on time and with high quality; and at the same time, to explore new innovative ideas that can improve and optimize the design.  

**Inside this Business Group**
------------------------------

  

IP Engineering Group's (IPG) vision Build IPs that power Intel's leadership products and power our customer's silicon. We want to attract & retain talent who get joy in building high quality IP and share our core belief that IP is fundamental to transforming Intel's silicon design process. IPG's guiding principles will be ensuring Quality (Zero Bugs), Customer Obsession (Delight our Customers) and structured Problem Solving. We are a fearless organization transforming IP development.  

**Other Locations**
-------------------

  

IN, Hyderabad  

**Posting Statement**
---------------------

  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.  

**Benefits**
------------

  

We offer a total compensation package that ranks among the best in the industry. It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. Find more information about all of our Amazing Benefits here.  

  

It has come to our notice that some people have received fake job interview letters ostensibly issued by Intel, inviting them to attend interviews in Intel’s offices for various positions and further requiring them to deposit money to be eligible for the interviews. We wish to bring to your notice that these letters are not issued by Intel or any of its authorized representatives. Hiring at Intel is based purely on merit and Intel does not ask or require candidates to deposit any money. We would urge people interested in working for Intel, to apply directly at https://jobs.intel.com/ and not fall prey to unscrupulous elements.  

**Working Model**
-----------------

title: Validation Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------

  

If you are passionate about computer graphics and working with leading graphics engineers on Intel's latest GPU/CPU architecture, then our Client GFX and AI Graphics Engineering (CGAI) Team has opportunities for you. Client GFX and AI Graphics Engineering (CGAI) is responsible for delivering industry-leading GPU (3D, media, compute, and display) hardware intellectual property (IP) blocks and system-on-chip (SoC) products for discrete graphics and throughput computing. We strive to lead the industry through continuous innovation and world-class engineering. The Discrete Graphics SoC team is within CGAI and we charter/responsible for improving the energy efficiency of our Xe GPUs. As a member of Pre-Si verification/validation team, you will be verifying the most complex SOCs in the various functional domains of PCI, Security, Power Management, Clocks, Resets. Our development activities include SoC Validation Strategy, Test Plan, coverage, running regressions, debugging bugs, getting involved in post-si debug, emulation etc.  

**Qualifications**
------------------

  

You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Minimum (must haves) Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering or computer engineering with 6+ years of experience or a master's degree in electrical engineering or computer engineering 6+ years of experience in 5 or more of the following 1. Test Bench bring-up at SoC and strong programming skills in System Verilog, OVM and UVM. 2. Test Plan development experience. 3. Enabling regressions, maintaining QoV (quality of validation) with good functional/code/other coverage metrics. 4. Familiarity with both simulation and emulation environments. 5. Strong CPU/GPU architecture understanding. 6. RTL Debugging module level or soc level system simulation failures. 7. Building emulation models, enabling content 8. Working with Validation Engineers and central CAD teams to support and maintain verification requirements in terms of Automation and tool flow support. 9. Coordinating with Val team on CAD Requirement with support CAD, IT and Engineering Compute Teams. 10. Act as focal point between design and tool vendors for issues and feature enhancements. 11. Training/Supporting Validation Engineers in CAD tool flow and Infrastructure 12. Monitoring and improve existing simulation environments and simulation efficiency.  

**Inside this Business Group**
------------------------------

  

The Client Computing Group (CCG) is responsible for driving business strategy and product development for Intel's PC products and platforms, spanning form factors such as notebooks, desktops, 2 in 1s, all in ones. Working with our partners across the industry, we intend to deliver purposeful computing experiences that unlock people's potential - allowing each person use our products to focus, create and connect in ways that matter most to them. As the largest business unit at Intel, CCG is investing more heavily in the PC, ramping its capabilities even more aggressively, and designing the PC experience even more deliberately, including delivering a predictable cadence of leadership products. As a result, we are able to fuel innovation across Intel, providing an important source of IP and scale, as well as help the company deliver on its purpose of enriching the lives of every person on earth.  

**Other Locations**
-------------------

  

IN, Hyderabad  

**Posting Statement**
---------------------

  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.  

**Benefits**
------------

  

We offer a total compensation package that ranks among the best in the industry. It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. Find more information about all of our Amazing Benefits here.  

  

It has come to our notice that some people have received fake job interview letters ostensibly issued by Intel, inviting them to attend interviews in Intel’s offices for various positions and further requiring them to deposit money to be eligible for the interviews. title: Development Operations Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------

  

Ensures the efficient planning, provisioning, installation/configuration, maintenance, and/or operations of the hardware and software infrastructure required to build, validate, and release a wide variety of hardware and software products and projects. Works closely with development and quality teams to derive infrastructure design requirements, build, test, and automate tools appropriate to the project, and/or implements and maintains of those systems within the constraints imposed by Intel enterprise infrastructure (IT) and other governing bodies. Owns the end to end delivery pipeline, including source code management, versioning/tagging strategy, component build and packaging, test automation tooling, release staging, acceptance and/or indicators, required security and IP scans, any third-party conformance tools, artifact storage and distribution, and disaster recovery planning. Identifies opportunities and implements solutions for increased automation, reliability, and/or velocity within the pipeline through implementation of robust infrastructure telemetry, KPIs, and indicators, and by monitoring and applying industry best practices.An ideal candidate would exhibit behavioral traits that indicate excellent communication skills  

**Qualifications**
------------------

  

You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your degree, research and or relevant previous job and or internship experiences.  

  

Minimum Qualifications  

Bachelors with 4 or more years experience or Masters with 3+ or more years of experience in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering or a related engineering discipline.  

  

2 or more experience with the following skills:  

  

Deployment experience in Github actions , Terraform or similar in multicloud(AWS, AZURE, GCP)  

Debugging skills in Linux environment.  

Service mesh (istio/linkerd)  

Kubernetes/ Helm  

agile and test driven deployment.  

  

Preferred Qualifications:  

Good understanding of Hardware based security technologies such as TEE-SGX , TPM, TXT, etc  

Security certifications such as CISSP, CCSP, CompTIA Security+ are a plus.  

tools: maven, ant, git, tortoise git, github  

Experience in key security concepts like cryptography, data encryption, key/certificate management, identity, security, and access management is highly preferred.

**Inside this Business Group**
------------------------------

  

Enable amazing computing experiences with Intel Software continues to shape the way people think about computing – across CPU, GPU, and FPGA architectures. Get your hands on new technology and collaborate with some of the smartest people in the business. Our developers and software engineers work in all software layers, across multiple operating systems and platforms to enable cutting-edge solutions. Ready to solve some of the most complex software challenges? Explore an impactful and innovative career in Software.

title: Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------

  

Designs, develops, and builds analog circuits in advanced process nodes for analog and mixedsignal IPs. Designs floorplans, performs circuit design, extracts chip parameters, and simulates analog behavior models. Creates test plans to verify design according to circuit and block microarchitecture specifications and evaluates test results. Verifies functionality to optimize circuit for power, performance, area, timing, and yield goals. Collaborates cross functionally to report design progress and collects, tracks, and resolves any performance and circuit design issues. Optimizes performance, power, area, and reduces leakage of circuits. Works with architecture and layout team to design circuit for best functionality, robustness, and electrical capabilities.  

**Qualifications**
------------------

  

Desired Skills and Experience:Looking for a candidate with BE plus 8 years of experience OR ME with 6 years of experience in analog design and developmentExperience in designing analog and mixed-signal circuits in standard CMOS technologies such as op-amps, comparators, bandgap references, linear regulators etcExperience with backend performance and reliability verification tools including Monte Carlo, EMIR, static/dynamic MOSFET voltage checks, etcUnderstanding of switching voltage regulators such as Buck converters is a plus.Post-Si debug experience and experience of productizing design in high volume production is a plus.Expected to perform well in a fast-paced collaborative team environment, to execute to meet our customer commitment on time and with high quality; and at the same time, to explore new innovative ideas that can improve and optimize the design.  

**Inside this Business Group**
------------------------------

  

IP Engineering Group's (IPG) vision Build IPs that power Intel's leadership products and power our customer's silicon. We want to attract & retain talent who get joy in building high quality IP and share our core belief that IP is fundamental to transforming Intel's silicon design process. IPG's guiding principles will be ensuring Quality (Zero Bugs), Customer Obsession (Delight our Customers) and structured Problem Solving. We are a fearless organization transforming IP development.

title: Technical Support Engineer
description:
**About Avaya**
---------------



Businesses are built by the experiences they provide, and every day, millions of those experiences are delivered by Avaya. Organizations trust Avaya to provide innovative solutions for some of their most important ambitions and challenges, giving them the freedom to engage their customers and employees in ways that deliver the greatest business benefits.



Avaya contact center and communications solutions help power immersive, personalized, and unforgettable customer experiences that drive business momentum. With the freedom to choose their journey, there’s no limit to the experiences Avaya customers can create.



The richness of Avaya’s global team diversity is our greatest strength, and we are committed to being a workplace where authenticity and individuality are celebrated and different perspectives are embraced. Learn more at www.avaya.com.

**Job Information**
-------------------



Job Code: 00255941


Job Family: Services


Job Function: Services Engineering

**Short Description**
---------------------



An individual contributor who provides remote post-sales support of software and/or hardware systems, sub-systems and/or applications for customers or field personnel utilizing telephone and remote diagnostic capabilities. Provides support for end user installations of medium complexity, configurations, upgrades and migrations through basic problem solving and troubleshooting. Includes supporting 3rd party products and occasional on-site support. Analyzes symptoms, logs, and data required to resolve issues of medium complexity. Proposes and monitors the implementation of solutions for non-routine customer reported incidents to ensure that situation is resolved. May proactively monitor for downstream effects as a result of the fix. May highlight other issues. Works with limited guidance on projects within defined criteria.

**Experience**
--------------


2 - 3 Years of Experience**Education**
-------------


Bachelor degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering**Preferred Certifications**
----------------------------


**Footer**
----------


Avaya is an Equal Opportunity employer and a U.S. Federal Contractor. Our commitment to equality is a core value of Avaya. All qualified applicants and employees receive equal treatment without consideration for race, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran or any other protected characteristic. In general, positions at Avaya require the ability to communicate and use office technology effectively. Physical requirements may vary by assigned work location. This job brief/description is subject to change. Nothing in this job description restricts Avaya right to alter the duties and responsibilities of this position at any time for any reason. You may also review the Avaya Global Privacy Policy (accessible at https://www.avaya.com/en/privacy/policy/) and applicable Privacy Statement relevant to this job posting (accessible at https://www.avaya.com/en/documents/info-applicants.pdf).

title: Security Operations Manager
description:
Summary  

Experience Required:  

**5 - 20 Years**  

Job Term:  

**Permanent**  

Location:  

**Bangalore; Hyderabad**  

Category:  

**Semiconductor Design**  

  

  

World leader in innovative memory solutions
  

  

Job responsibilities:
  

  

* Verification of complex Storage Controller ASIC SOCs and sub-system using Best-In-Class methodologies and Processes
* Lead and Drive Deliverables for SOC Verification using SOC\\_UVM and Processor based SoC verification
* Planning and Strategizing Team Execution towards Efficient, Scalable SOC Verification Environment and Methodologies
* Provide continuous support to FW Team and ensure Quality deliverables on FPGA / Emulation Platforms from DV
* Lead and drive verification towards Gate level simulations for Complex large flat chip Netlists
* Interact with Architecture, Design and FW Team to establish standard flows and Deliverables alignments
* Work across a challenging schedule and maximize Teams efficiency using Automation, Portability and Reusability
* Lead and drive Silicon Bringup activities and establish sustained and Efficient support for FW development
* Lead and drive full SOC Verification / Validation execution from Arch-requirements understanding to FW support till end product QS
* Plan and ramp-up the team for enabling multiple Controller SOC verification in parallel with High Quality and Efficiency


  

Job Qualifications
  

  

* Bachelors/Masters in Engineering with Overall Verification domain experience of 14+ years
* Minimum 10+ years of experience in SOC verification using C, UVM and sub-system verification
* Minimum 3+ years of experience in Test controller, Debug and DFT verification
* Minimum 3+ years of Experience in managing teams of 10+ engineers and Leads Management
* Good experience in collaborating with engineering teams across multiple Geographies

title: Rf Engineer
description:
As an RF (Radio Frequency) Field Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, maintaining, and optimizing wireless communication systems. Your primary focus will be on radio frequency and microwave systems, ensuring optimal performance, coverage, and reliability. You will work in the field, collaborating with a multidisciplinary team, and may be required to travel to various locations to install, troubleshoot, and maintain RF equipment.

Key Responsibilities:

* **RF Design and Optimization:**
* Design and optimize RF networks for maximum coverage, capacity, and performance.
* Conduct site surveys to assess the physical and environmental factors affecting RF propagation.
* **Site Installation and Commissioning:**
* Install and commission RF equipment, antennas, and associated hardware at designated sites.
* Ensure proper integration with existing systems and adherence to technical specifications.
* **Troubleshooting and Maintenance:**
* Identify and resolve RF-related issues through thorough troubleshooting and diagnostic procedures.
* Perform routine maintenance activities to ensure the ongoing functionality of RF systems.
* **Interference Management:**
* Investigate and mitigate RF interference issues, ensuring minimal impact on communication systems.
* Implement measures to minimize external interference and maintain optimal signal quality.
* **Documentation:**
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of RF network configurations, installations, and modifications.
* Prepare technical reports, including signal strength measurements, interference analysis, and system performance evaluations.
* **Collaboration and Communication:**
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including network engineers, project managers, and technicians, to achieve project goals.
* Communicate effectively with clients, providing technical support and addressing their concerns.
* **Training:**
* Provide training and support to other team members or clients on RF equipment operation, maintenance, and troubleshooting.
* **Regulatory Compliance:**
* Ensure compliance with regulatory standards and guidelines related to RF communication systems.

Qualifications and Skills:

* Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Telecommunications, or a related field.
* Proven experience in RF design, installation, and troubleshooting.
* Proficient in the use of RF testing equipment and tools.
* Strong understanding of wireless communication principles and protocols.
* Familiarity with regulatory requirements and standards in the RF field.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: ₹10,000.00 - ₹40,000.00 per month

Benefits:

* Provident Fund

Work Location: In person

title: Electronics Engineer
description:
Responsibilities:

 Create novel ways to apply skills learned during testing or from application feedback to

benefit the company and our products.

 Designing and developing electronic systems and components for use in vehicles like

controllers, instrument cluster, sensors, digital/analogue fuel gauge etc.

 Benchmarking competitor EV battery packs (stacks) and other electrical/electronic EV

components and interacting with the Hardware design team to optimize the design.

 Selecting electrical components that would enable proper and optimum operation of vehicle

and the battery pack.

 Designing the SOP for electronics installation, fault identification and analysis(independently and with used within the assigned system).

 Training the on-site service personnel to operate the OBD (On Board Diagnostic) system and repair/replace the damaged components.

 End to end testing of the battery system in sync with the electronics and record the data for further optimization and modification.

 Logic development and selection of auxiliaries required for the battery system.

 Design and fabricate test equipment for the required mechanical, thermal, and electrical

systems, EV vehicle test bench.

 Ensure test results are documented in a clear, concise, and timely manner

 Working with the battery and hardware design teams to improve and optimize the

performance of the implemented battery system performance.

 Perform the plant modelling, model-based design (MBD) and testing (HiL/MiL) of the EV

battery system.

 Troubleshoot and resolve issues that arise during testing and/or during production.

 Interacting with the certification team (ICAT, ARAI etc) in defining/performing the testing

standards for battery systems for EV.

What you’ll need

 Relevant experience in Coding, Reliability Testing, JMP software knowledge, DOE process

optimization, Quality management, benchmarking, characterization, and validation of

Electric Vehicles.

 Experience of setting up experiments to achieve desired testing results.

 A strong understanding of Li-ion battery and/or other battery chemistry systems used in

Electric Vehicles

 Knowledge and/or relevant experience in high power DC-DC Converters, Inverters, and

motor drives.

 Knowledge of AC and DC industrial motors (like PMSM. BLDC, induction) and drives.

 Must have experience in EMI and EMC testing.

 Testing experience for Indian electrical standards on BMS, DC-DC converter and safety (ex.:IS-5216, IS-5571, IS 7788, IS-62368).

 Good understanding of V-cycle, functional safety, automotive standards and Regulations

 Hands-on experience of Model Based Development (MBD), Hardware-in-Loop (HIL), Model-

inLoop (MIL) and Software-in-Loop(SIL) testing using software like MATLAB.

 Experience in instrumentation, integration, and calibration of sensors.

 Experience of data acquisition systems, analysing and managing test data from large data sets.

 Excellent communication skills and team-oriented attitude

 Comfortable with initiating and taking ownership of projects.

 Experience of using various communication protocols (CAN, LIN, I2C, SPI, UART etc.)

 Experience in PCB designing on Electrical CAD(Altium preferred not compulsory).

 Embedded level programming skills in 32-bit ARM processor core (preferable)

title: Assistant Manager
description:
**Company Description**  

Harsco Corporation is a market-leading, global provider of environmental solutions for industrial, retail and medical waste streams, and innovative equipment and technology for the rail sector. We have an unrivalled breadth of experience across the globe and an impressive reputation stretching back more than a century. Based in Camp Hill, PA, with more than 13,000 employees and the company operates in more than 30 countries.


About Harsco Environmental


Harsco Environmental is the premier provider of material processing and environmental services to the global steel and metals industries. Our onsite mill services and resource recovery services offer sustainable solutions that maximize environmental benefit and return valuable raw material into production. We also have developed a range of by-products for specialized applications across industry, construction and agriculture, which utilize Harsco’s expertise in mineral materials.

 **Job Description** **Job Summary:**


To control the electrical and instrumentation maintenance, annual budgetary plan for electrical maintenance; Maintenance schedule for Preventive and proactive. Standard Work procedures to attend maintenance works. Plant reliability by reduce break downs. Training to the agency work force.
